command_list.b0:
ABOUT THIS BUTTON
---
Pull down for more info:
This will help you create a dedicated follower alert similar to the types
of alerts you'd see in StreamLabs or StreamElements, complete with a
random image and (optionally) displaying the name of a follower.

GEARWORKS
---
Pull down for more info:
Things you generally don't need to touch, like data pulls,
but are useful to look at if you want to know how the cookies
are made.

PULL FOLLOWER NAME
---
Pull down for more info:
Pulls the name of the latest follower and saves it as a variable.
The follower name won't display in OBS or in Twitch chat unless
you specifically tell SAMMI to display it by using the variable.

ALERT ACTIONS
---
Pull down for more info:
Put all the actions you want to play when the alert is triggered here.
I've filled out a simple example below, but this is SAMMI - if you can
dream it up, you can make it happen, so don't be afraid to experiment!

RANDOM IMAGE PULL AND SOURCE CHANGE
---
Pull down for more info:
This relies on using SAMMI's "Random" and "Source Change Settings"
commands to pull a random image from a set file path.
While the "Settings (JSON)" section may look intimidating,
it's pretty easy to understand once you know how it works.
You can find more info here:
https://sammi.solutions/docs/commands/obs-settings

This method works for pretty much any type of supported image as
long as they're all the same file type, including PNGs, JPGs,
animated GIFs, and more, so gather up your favorites!

It's recommended to include a very slight delay, usually 10 ms,
to allow the image to update before running additional commands.

TEXT AND IMAGE FADE IN / FADE OUT
---
Pull down for more info:
A basic set of commands that causes a single image and text to fade in, display
for a bit, then fade out, similar to alerts you might see from Streamlabs
or StreamElements.
(This assumes that you already have a set image / video source and a
text source set up in OBS. If you have images that are different sizes, you'll
probably want to use the Edit Transform tool in OBS to set the media source to
scale to inner bounds.)

COLOR CORRECTION
You'll need to apply Filter > Color Correction to your sources for the fade effect to
work correctly. The commands below will handle the rest. If no filter is applied,
SAMMI will display a string of error messages, and the effect won't work.

DELAY (MS)
The number of milliseconds before a command runs. 1000 ms = 1 second.
Commands run based on the delay that's been set, allowing you to customize
exactly when each command runs.

CHAT MESSAGE
---
Pull down for more info:
Just what it says on the tin, sends a message to chat.
You can also use the following variable:

/$followName$/ - Displays the follower's name in the chat message.
